sub_title: University Lecturer in Development Studies at Leiden University - Faculty of Humanities | Institute for History | Latin American Studies
summary:
I am an Assistant Professor at Leiden University. I teach courses on Economy: Latin America and Practising International Studies at the Bachelor in International Studies and contribute to the course Organisational Theory, Culture and Behaviour. I am currently supervising several internships and MA theses. My courses deal with two consistent streams of literature: political economy and development studies.

While my work focuses on the Latin American region, I welcome the opportunity to collaborate with students and organisations whose research focus is on other regions but deal with issues of social exclusion, inequality, poverty studies and/or social policy.

>	Designing and delivering curriculum for an economy course in Latin America, focusing on the shared political economy features of the region and its relationship to the world economy.
>	I facilitated academic and professional collaborations between Leiden University, international organisations, and students through my expertise and professional networks.
>	Supervising academic internships for students, fostering the integration of theoretical knowledge with practical experience in Development Studies.', 'title': 'University Lecturer in Development Studies', 'employment_type': 'Permanent'}, {'location': 'Leiden, South Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Leiden University', 'description': 'This network’s primary goal is to promote a more inclusive working and learning environment. The network focuses specifically on issues, rather than a specific group among staff members, in order to ensure an inclusive dialogue and approach. This network takes up: - Issues of exclusion within the university using an approach that recognises that gender, race, ethnicity, class, sexual orientation, disability etc. intersect with each other. - Supporting international staff and underrepresented groups through activities that allow the sharing of knowledge and experiences, facilitate dialogue and consultation, and contribute to community building. - The network collaborates with colleagues at various levels and organisational departments, in particular HRM, Student and Educational Affairs, and Communication & Marketing on relevant issues such as recruitment, diversity and inclusion in curricula and in the classroom, as well as the way in which the university presents itself to the outside world. - The network contributes to the visibility, recognition, and resolution of issues related to racism and other forms of exclusion within the working and learning environment of the university by collaborating with different partners within the university and by advising the Executive Board based on its scholarly expertise in this area.', 'title': 'Chairperson of the Leiden University and Equality Network (LUDEN)', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'The Hague', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Leiden University', 'description': '>	I taught various courses for the International Studies programme while completing my full-time PhD at the ISS. Despite the demanding workload, I could effectively manage my time and deliver high-quality instruction to students. The courses I taught were highly interdisciplinary, spanning disciplines such as economics, international studies, and Latin American studies.
>	In 2017-2018, I served as a co-lecturer for the course International Economics, where I shared my expertise in international trade, finance and macroeconomic issues. During the same period, I also taught the course Economics: Latin America, which focused on the economic challenges and opportunities in the region. I also taught Economics, a course covering the fundamental micro and macroeconomics concepts.
>	Additionally, I served as a coach for the course Practising International Studies, where I assisted students in developing their research skills, critical thinking abilities, and presentation skills. I also taught several other courses, such as International Economics, Configuring the World (Lecture Tutorials) and Configuring the World (Project Tutorials).', 'title': 'Lecturer', 'employment_type':
